Articles.Content:
Mods: https://www.dropbox.com/s/s5zazsiv6tyj1wt/2018-10-14_13-56-35.png?dl=0 BTW it's classic shell i'm not running on XP

output.log: https://www.dropbox.com/s/nlu8eqrtxvuj1kr/output_log (2).txt?dl=0

So basically I'm launching my Jemini Test rocket and it begins switching through all my crafts that are active like space junk, satellites, aircraft debris etc as if i was clicking my brackets. I had Easy vessel switch so i uninstalled that using CKAN, I went back into the game and the issue persists. I have a feeling it has to do with either KerbalKonstructs or Physics Range Extender but i'm not sure. If you are smarter than me, please help me and jump into the output.log to see what went wrong. Thanks!

Edited October 14, 2018 by RocketSimplicity
Incorrect link

A very strange issue...

Well, first of all: The log doesn't seem to be the right one. The screenshot  shows a KSP folder called 'KSP 1.4.5 Mod' but the log shows KSP 1.3.1. The location of the log file is a different one since KSP 1.4, I would suggest to take a look into this thread to find the correct log:

In addition, there is still a mod folder called 'EasyVesselSwitch'...does it contain anything? Maybe something went wrong when CKAN tried to uninstall it, I would suggest to delete the folder manually.
Apropos manually: Did you install BDAc through CKAN as well? The mod does not offically support CKAN, so maybe you should try to install it (incl. physics range extender) manually as well.

The output.log should be the right one now 4x4cheesecake. I opened Easy Vessel Switch and it went like this: EVS/Plugins/MiniAVC I have deleted it and am going to see what happened. If it isn't fixed i will delete BDA and download it manually like you said, but BDA did seem to be working well before I installed EVS and a few other mods like Mechjeb.

EDIT: It didn't change anything...

Will try uninstalling BDA and PRE and see what happens.

Edited October 14, 2018 by RocketSimplicity
removed mention as it would be annoying that the problem's solved

It turns out KK has issues working with Physics range extender in recent updates according to the forum page. Thanks for your help! @4x4cheesecake

Edited October 14, 2018 by RocketSimplicity
